complexity

Class Tester

  • java.lang.Object
    • complexity.Tester

  • public class Tester
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a facility for timing execution of a Timer's method, for increasing values of method's parameter (modelling the "size of the problem"), terminating the test sequence when a maximum execution time is exceeded.
    Version:
    October 2019
    Author:
    Hugh Osborne

    • Method Detail

      • report

        public static void report(java.lang.String message,
                          java.lang.String header)
        Print an information message. If popups are being used then a popup will be used. Otherwise the message is printed to the console.
        Parameters:
        message - the message
        header - the message title

      • testSequence

        public static void testSequence(Timer timer,
                                int font,
                                java.lang.String[] args)
        Run through a sequence of tests. Code is tested for n = 1,2,..,9, then 10,20,..,90 and so on for increasing powers of ten. The sequence of tests terminates when the execution time of the method exceeds the time limit, or the size of n reaches 109.
        Parameters:
        timer - the Timer object to be timed.
        font - specifies the the font size to be used in popups. A value of zero will disable popups.
        args - possibly passed from a call of testSequence in a main method, and may contain, in order, Strings determining:
        • the problem size to be timed to establish a base for time estimates
        • the number of times the timer is timed in each test run for any one problem size
        • the delay (in milliseconds) to be used for the timer, determining its basic speed
        • the limit at or beyond which the test sequence will terminate
        With the limit argument, a positive value indicates a limiting execution time (in seconds), a negative value indicates a limiting problem size (given by the absolute value of the limit). If any of these arguments are not provided in args the user will be prompted for them.
